job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newcastle upon Tyne, England
pros: Some nice clients that you work with
cons: Absolute joke of a company. Expect you to work 60-70 hours a week and complain/ become blunt and rude if you turn down extra shifts. Nobody ever thanks you and expects you to do a team leader/managers amount of paper work. Company says yes to new service users weekly even though they don't have staffing level to cover it. Service users hours get claimed by company even though the support isn't given as they are all about the money. Called themselves a charity but are just another tax avoiding company.

pros: Great clients. They are why you don't quit.

job_title: Children's Support Worker in Poole, England
pros: The young people and front line staff

review_title: No Feedback or Response from Interview
pros: Staff seem friendly enough and the charitable objectives of the organisation are ones in which I fully support.
cons: Wasted my time interviewing when no response or feedback was provided. I gave up paid time in order to attend the interview which lasted 2 hours and was intense (rightly so!). I simply wanted to be informed of the outcome without having to chase myself 2 weeks later.

review_title: Yes for Clients no to Employer

cons: Poor management, company shows no compassion to staff, head office couldn't organise a drink night in a brewy to put it nicely.
